title: Make selected configuration darker
body:
[IMG_1]
---
Glossary:
github_pr_1: The image attached to the ticket is a screenshot of a GitHub pull request. The pull request shows a diff of changes made to a CSS file. The changes include modifications to a CSS class responsible for the background color of a configuration selection element. The original color code has been replaced with a new one. The old color code was a lighter shade, while the new color code is a significantly darker shade. The intention behind the change seems to be to make the selected configuration stand out more to the user. There are comments on the pull request from other team members indicating approval of the change, suggesting that the darker color improves visibility and user experience. There are no merge conflicts indicated, and the pull request appears to be ready for a final review before merging.
image_2: The image displays a user interface section with a list of configurations under the heading "Testimonials". There are three configurations listed vertically: "Configuration 1", "Configuration 2", and "Configuration 3". Each configuration has an associated icon to the left and right. The left icons for Configuration 1 and Configuration 2 are green circles with a white checkmark, while Configuration 3 has a grey circle with an "i" in the center. The right icons for Configuration 2 and Configuration 3 are red squares with a white trash can symbol, indicating a delete function. Configuration 1 has no such icon on the right.

Configuration 1 is highlighted with a very light background, which is barely distinguishable from the white background of the rest of the UI. The text for Configuration 1 is also bold, suggesting it is the currently selected configuration. The "+ Add new configuration" option is at the bottom of the list, styled as a hyperlink.

The task is to make the background of the currently selected configuration, which is Configuration 1, darker to enhance its visibility as the active selection.
issue_summary:
- CSS class responsible for background color of configuration selection element modified
- Original color code replaced with new, darker color code
- Comments indicate approval of the darker color for improved visibility and user experience
- No merge conflicts in the pull request
- Pull request ready for final review before merging
- User interface section with configurations under "Testimonials"
- Configurations: "Configuration 1", "Configuration 2", "Configuration 3"
- Icons: Green circles with checkmark for Configuration 1 and 2, grey circle with "i" for Configuration 3
- Delete function: Red squares with trash can symbol for Configuration 2 and 3
- Configuration 1 highlighted with very light background, text bolded, indicating current selection
- Task: Enhance visibility of the active selection by making the background darker
repo_summary:
The software project is a complex web application divided into different modules such as `web`, `extensions`, `theme-app-extension-src`, and `widgets`. It utilizes TypeScript, React, and Shopify libraries for frontend development and Node.js for backend services. The project follows a modular structure with separate package.json files for each module, managing dependencies and scripts specific to their functionalities.

The issue at hand involves enhancing the visibility of the currently selected configuration in the checkout editor. This requires adjusting the background color of the selected configuration element to make it stand out more. The relevant code for this task can be found in files related to the checkout editor components, such as `web/client/src/pages/checkout/checkout-editor/components/widget-list/components/selection-icon-color.tsx` and `web/client/src/pages/checkout/checkout-editor-v2/components/containers/WidgetMenuList.tsx`. Additionally, CSS styles in files like `web/client/src/libs/checkout-ui/utilities/legacy/styles.css` may need to be modified to achieve the desired visual effect.

                                  key={value.configurations?.[0]?.id}

                                                      index: 0,

<>
                                <Checkbox
                                    label="Show all images"
                                    checked={config.switcher?.showAll}
                                    onChange={(val) =>
                                        onChangeConfig({
                                            switcher: {
                                                ...config.switcher,
                                                showAll: val,
                                            },
                                        })
                                    }
                                />
                                <Checkbox
                                    label="Show carousel images as perfect squares"
                                    checked={!config.switcher?.imageFitContain}
                                    onChange={(val) =>
                                        onChangeConfig({
                                            switcher: {
                                                ...config.switcher,
                                                imageFitContain: !val,
                                            },
                                        })
                                    }
                                />
                            </>
                        )}

                        <VerticalStack gap="2">
                            <Text variant="bodyMd" as="p">
                                Custom product image
                            </Text>
                            <ImageUploader
                                onUpload={(result: { file: string }) => {
                                    onChangeConfig({
                                        customFirstImageUrl: result.file,
                                    });
                                }}
                                onDelete={() => {
                                    onChangeConfig({
                                        customFirstImageUrl: undefined,
                                    });
                                }}
                                file={
                                    offerVersion === 'v2' && config.customFirstImageUrl
                                        ? { file: config.customFirstImageUrl }
                                        : null
                                }
                            />
                        </VerticalStack>
                    </ShowAdvanced>
                </VerticalStack>
            </SectionSettings>

                    {isSingleConfigV2

solution_task.structured_resp:
Clarify:
The task is to enhance the visibility of the currently selected configuration in the checkout editor by adjusting the background color to make it stand out more. The relevant files for this task are `web/client/src/pages/checkout/checkout-editor/components/widget-list/components/selection-icon-color.tsx`, `web/client/src/pages/checkout/checkout-editor-v2/components/containers/WidgetMenuList.tsx`, and `web/client/src/libs/checkout-ui/utilities/legacy/styles.css`.

Hypothesize:
The issue likely involves modifying the CSS class that sets the background color for the selected configuration element. The solution may require updating the CSS properties in the `styles.css` file or adjusting the inline styles or class assignments in the React components.

Experiment:
- Review the CSS class definitions in `web/client/src/libs/checkout-ui/utilities/legacy/styles.css` to identify the class responsible for the background color of the selected configuration element.
- Inspect the React components `selection-icon-color.tsx` and `WidgetMenuList.tsx` to see how they apply the CSS class to the selected element.

Analyze:
Based on the provided information, the relevant files for the task have been identified. The CSS file likely contains the class definitions that need to be updated, and the React components are where the classes are applied to the elements.

Resolve:
- Open the `web/client/src/libs/checkout-ui/utilities/legacy/styles.css` file and locate the CSS class that sets the background color for the selected configuration element.
- Update the background color value to the new, darker color code as per the requirement for improved visibility.
- If the background color is set inline within the React components (`selection-icon-color.tsx` or `WidgetMenuList.tsx`), update the inline style or the class assignment to use the updated CSS class.
- Ensure that the color contrast remains accessible and meets WCAG guidelines for text visibility against the background.
- Test the changes in the checkout editor to confirm that the selected configuration element is now more visibly distinct with the darker background color.
- Commit the changes and update the pull request with a description of the changes made for the final review before merging.
solution_task.response:
To enhance the user experience in the checkout editor, it's essential to make the selected configuration more visually prominent. This can be achieved by adjusting the background color to a darker shade, ensuring it stands out against other elements. The focus will be on updating the CSS properties and ensuring the changes are reflected in the relevant React components.

- Locate the CSS class responsible for the background color of the selected configuration element in the `styles.css` file.
- Modify the background color property to a darker shade that improves visibility while adhering to accessibility standards.
- In the React components `selection-icon-color.tsx` and `WidgetMenuList.tsx`, apply the updated CSS class to the selected element.
- Verify that the color contrast is compliant with WCAG guidelines to maintain accessibility.
- Test the updated background color in the checkout editor to ensure the selected configuration is now more distinguishable.
- After confirming the visual enhancement, commit the code changes and prepare a detailed pull request for review.

colorInteractiveTextHovered: ({ interactive }) =>
        interactive?.foreground?.adjust({
            l: (l) => l + 10,
        }),
    colorInteractiveTextPressed: ({ interactive }) =>
        interactive?.foreground?.adjust({
            l: (l) => l + 10,
        }),

    /* COLOR INFO */
    colorInfo: ({ info }) => info?.background,
    colorInfoDisabled: ({ info }) => colorDisabled(info),
    colorInfoSubdued: ({ info }) => colorSubdued(info),
    colorInfoText: ({ info }, legacy) => colorText(info, legacy),
    colorInfoTextSubdued: ({ info }, legacy) => colorTextSubdued(info, legacy),
    colorInfoTextEmphasized: ({ info }, legacy) => colorTextEmphasized(info, legacy),
    colorInfoBorder: ({ info }, legacy) => colorBorder(info, legacy),
    colorInfoBorderEmphasized: ({ info }, legacy) => colorBorderEmphasized(info, legacy),
    colorInfoAccent: ({ info }) => info?.accent,

    /* COLOR SUCCESS */
    colorSuccess: ({ success }) => success?.background,
    colorSuccessDisabled: ({ success }) => colorDisabled(success),
    colorSuccessSubdued: ({ success }) => colorSubdued(success),

    colorSuccessBorder: ({ success }, legacy) => colorBorder(success, legacy),
    colorSuccessBorderEmphasized: ({ success }, legacy) => colorBorderEmphasized(success, legacy),
    colorSuccessAccent: ({ success }) => success?.accent,

    /* COLOR WARNING */
    colorWarning: ({ warning }) => warning?.background,
    colorWarningDisabled: ({ warning }) => colorDisabled(warning),
    colorWarningSubdued: ({ warning }) => colorSubdued(warning),
    colorWarningText: ({ warning }, legacy) => colorText(warning, legacy),
    colorWarningTextSubdued: ({ warning }, legacy) => colorTextSubdued(warning, legacy),

    colorWarningBorderEmphasized: ({ warning }, legacy) => colorBorderEmphasized(warning, legacy),
    colorWarningAccent: ({ warning }) => warning?.accent,

    /* COLOR CRITICAL */
    colorCritical: ({ critical }) => critical?.background,
    colorCriticalDisabled: ({ critical }) => colorDisabled(critical),
    colorCriticalSubdued: ({ critical }) => colorSubdued(critical),

To enhance the user experience in the checkout editor, it's essential to make the selected configuration more visually prominent. This can be achieved by adjusting the background color to a darker shade, ensuring it stands out against other elements. The focus will be on updating the CSS properties and ensuring the changes are reflected in the relevant React components.

- Locate the CSS class responsible for the background color of the selected configuration element in the `styles.css` file.
- Modify the background color property to a darker shade that improves visibility while adhering to accessibility standards.
- In the React components `selection-icon-color.tsx` and `WidgetMenuList.tsx`, apply the updated CSS class to the selected element.
- Verify that the color contrast is compliant with WCAG guidelines to maintain accessibility.
- Test the updated background color in the checkout editor to ensure the selected configuration is now more distinguishable.
- After confirming the visual enhancement, commit the code changes and prepare a detailed pull request for review.
